text: @gruber You mean in post? How much editing do you do of Talk Shows? (The ending of this one was hauntingly good.)
@gruber Can't DM unless you follow me.
@dsquareddigest Was Eeyore Welsh?
@dsquareddigest Damn, this stuff is hilarious. I particularly like "Country Child".
@dsquareddigest Wow. Wait until disaffected American teenagers get ahold of this!
@dsquareddigest Also, don't think we've forgotten about that John Birt piece you owe us.
@dsquareddigest I'm slightly afraid to ask, but what is the Welsh outlook? Unremitting disgust with everything?
@dsquareddigest Not sure how the latter quite worked. Although I was pleased to see my friend's greatgrandfather in _The Guard_.
@dsquareddigest I'm now imagining http://t.co/JzD61vi is a journal of suicidal poetry funded by your family.
@tqbf Or NaCl?
@tqbf Why not say Keyczar then?
@tqbf Right. I think it's probably doable with existing primitives but God knows I'm not going to implement it myself.
@tqbf What I want is "the receiver knows that the message is from me, but he can't prove it to someone else later."
@tqbf Authenticators are more than just integrity checking: http://t.co/t1LFCJw
@dsquareddigest @maxbsawicky What do you have now?
@tqbf I'd be a lot more comfortable with you recommending PGP for everything if PGP had authenticators instead of just signatures.
@dsquareddigest "I'll have a comeback in the year 2000. I'll come back as the Sinatra of the 21st century."?
@dsquareddigest I don't think it's hyperbole to say that @DeanBaker13 is one of the most important people in the US progressive movement.
What did @AGSchneiderman say when he won? “This is a campaign, and it has been from the first day, of activists.” http://t.co/3oDuFmM
Note also that NY @AGSchneiderman is a @DeanBaker13 fan: http://t.co/oNEokkR Easy to understand why @matthewstoller has a crush.
Notice how @AGSchneiderman's bio he identifies him as a progressive activist first and an elected official second: http://t.co/oH6gtNu
@zunguzungu Cultural progress?
Jobs, 97: Taking the chairman's job, in particular, Jobs said, would "scare away" any real candidate for the CEO's job. http://t.co/tWryWZe
After losing $90M: "I feel a sense of freedom. People think that it's a joy to own things. But it really isn't." http://t.co/yTMi6VP
@gruber hints at this: Jobs, 1997: "The old board of directors at Apple is history." http://t.co/FW0KBDw http://t.co/6jHgjkA
@gruber's sentence-by-sentence analysis of Steve Jobs' resignation letter is pretty amazing: http://t.co/1MSs1Zw
The latest Greg Mortenson update is by far the most damning yet: http://t.co/MhEz28l Be sure to read to the end.
@kragen is really making the most of his 15 minutes of Hacker News fame.
@cambridgechron Sure! It's HUHS on Holyoke St if it wasn't obvious.
The entrance to the ER: http://t.co/lTnJhd9
When viewing a user's stream, Twitter should let you hide @replies so you can sensibly decide whether to follow them or not.
@PatHadley What's your thesis on?
@robin_ahn I'm saying someone should write a book setting them straight.
@robin_ahn Many brilliant quantum physicists went on to try to extend their physics into bogus speculation about society.
@floatingu claims "Our lectures are equivalent to taking a 600-page book and reading it in one hour." So your lecturers speak at 2500 wpm?
@dakami But Bohm of all people should have known better!
Someone should do a _Fashionable Nonsense_ that debunks bogus social theory spouted by quantum physicists. @kjhealy
If you're looking for some hurricane reading, the early chapters of http://t.co/RgT9kwi about the tropical storms in Haiti are gripping.
@Pinboard You seem to have stopped importing here http://t.co/qFmTRJ6 but the API still returns plenty of tweets from before then.
@Pinboard If I have tweet IDs via http://t.co/KoyStCj or something else, any way to import them?
@mattyglesias @dylanmatt If the Fed can't even _intentionally_ create inflation, isn't the dual mandate totally insane?
Maybe I can get them from the Library of Congress?
I just realized I could have @Pinboard archive my tweets, but it looks like the first 95 have been lost to history. :-(
Details: http://t.co/0DXsddr http://t.co/RKBPVqo http://t.co/LBy8Ztn
Charlie Crist asked Obama to stop sending Florida so many Haitian earthquake victims "so Miami would be ready for the upcoming Super Bowl".
@dakami Does anyone play WoW under their real name, though?
@migueldeicaza CEO of Whole Foods, caught sockpuppeting on Yahoo! Finance. http://t.co/4NKrBuG
@binarybits I bet you Gawker would be thrilled to run a story about that. "Whole Foods CEO Trolls Star Wars fansites as TofuJedi"
If Mark Zuckerberg were caught posting on the Internet under a psuedonym, it probably would be considered a lack of integrity.
I wonder how much of the psuedonym cluelessness among tech execs comes from the fact they really _can't_ use psuedonyms. Look at Mackey.
Quick. Can somebody ID Eric Schmidt and rank him downward? http://t.co/9IWcyem /via @doctorow
Paul Krguman explains how US economic policy is really about settling old scores between 1990s Princeton professors: http://t.co/Xlp9P2j
@djon3s I hope so.
@dakami Instead of RSS or Atom or the other things people were fighting about, people get their newsfeeds through Facebook and Twitter.
@stevej Yeah, but there was no centralized consumption to go along with it like on LiveJournal.
@stevej Right.
@stevej Ah. I meant more: Why did HTTP beat AOL/Compuserve/Prodigy but Twitter/Facebook beat RSS/Atom?
@stevej You were asked to implement LiveJournal for Google Search? How would that have worked?
@jorgeortiz85 It's easy to explain in retrospect, but did anyone foresee it at the time? And why did RSS lose but HTTP win?
Who would have thought during the RSS wars that it'd be the LiveJournal model that would ultimately end up winning?
@agl HSTS query on chrome://net-internals seems to be broken in the last few versions.
@sissenberg is my new master. RPahE is like a dream come true.
@mike3k Should people have refused to report that Mark Zuckerberg has a girlfriend? If not, why is this different?
@Pinboard When I try to Twitter OAuth, I always get a 500 on http://t.co/tBSKuhg
@mike3k Has Bob Mansfield talked about being straight?
@mike3k Why? Is there any evidence he's trying to keep it a secret?
Pointing out that Apple has a gay CEO isn't outing, it's reporting: http://t.co/ctepiws /by @joeclark
@mcuban Why does the Landmark website still use frames? It's a real pain to navigate.
@dsquareddigest's battle to stop grinding his teeth seems like the kind of comedic premise that you'd normally sell as a sitcom.
@blairsupporter is the @PeanutFreeMom of the UK politics.
Has anyone called dibs on writing the trend piece about the spate of trend pieces published while @jackshafer is unemployed?

Alan Kay: "People who are really serious about software should make their own hardware." /via @yoda_2little
Did every one of Steve Jobs' big ideas cone from 1970s Alan Kay? Mac=Alto, NeXT=Smalltalk, iPad=Dynabook...
@AfroCubanGirl Thanks for saying that. I hope you're right.
@textfiles @archiveteam Was talking to some old Air America Radio hosts and producers. Do you know anyone who archived their shows?
@kevinmarks Surprisingly dogmatic about semantic strict mode HTML. And those headers are mandatory. But otherwise pretty fun.

@lvdjgarcia How does increasing the contribution caps "reduce Social Security...spending"? This isn't about the deficit.
@lvdjgarcia You said everyone is looking at cutting Social Security. The Senate Majority Leader said clearly that he wasn't.
@lvdjgarcia But not social security.
@lvdjgarcia As recently as March, Harry Reid and other Senate Democrats promised not to touch social security: http://t.co/4lZBI89
@lvdjgarcia As I recall, Dems spent the Bush years resisting social security cuts. And rightly so -- cuts would be pointless and cruel.
@lvdjgarcia "He is _extremely_ committed...and is plotting politically feasible ways to reduce Social Security as well as health spending."
@lvdjgarcia @doctorow You can read the Brooks piece for yourself if you don't like paraphrase. It's pretty clear.
James J. Galbraith: Shared sacrifice reminds me of Anatole France--sacrifice is shared between those who can afford it and those who can't.
@AfroCubanGirl Why not? Would love to be proven wrong.
@matthewstoller Obama told Brooks he wanted to slash spending, Medicare, and social security--back in March 09: http://j.mp/noGkBO
Obama told David Brooks he wanted to slash spending, Medicare, and social security--back when he first took office: http://j.mp/noGkBO
Imagine you run buses hourly betw NYC and DC. 7p bus is 2h late. Do you board the crowd FIFO or LIFO? LIFO means fewer know you had a delay.
